intro: Gamochaeta deserticola, commonly known as the desert chamaedorea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading herb with slender stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Gamochaeta deserticola is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
